TopicTitle: Probes That Previously Worked Fine All Lost Signals

Articles.Content:
So I had gotten pretty far in my career game. I only had 4 mods installed through CKAN that were 1.9 compatible; Scatterer, X. Science continued, and both their dependencies. I then updated to version 1.10 and played ever since without any problems. However, today I flew a spaceplane and it crashed but it also crashed my game. I then jumped back in only to find that all my probes/unmanned vehicles lost signals even near the KSC. I have both uninstalled and reinstalled the mods separate times to see if anything would work but still no signals. All crafts previously worked fine until my game crashed. I don't know if there's anything to fix this. I have looked up the issue but it seems incredibly rare so finding a solution would be a blessing. Thanks and please let me know if I should send anything that could better explain the situation/glitch.

Edited July 5, 2020 by JoeKerbalGuy

If you post your save someone could at least confirm if it's that game or you're install, or maybe see what the problem is in the game.

Similarly you could start a new save to see if the problem carries over to it.

If you have Steam, try verifying files.

And for the dumb idea I should have thought of first, did you accidentally destroy your tracking station?

Some things I left out was that the issue didn’t happen in my other sandbox save and that the tracking station wasn’t damaged or destroyed. I did verify the files multiple times but still nothing. Also how do I post my save?

Most people use Dropbox I think, and yes there are a lot of smart people on this forum, so if the problem is in the save they may be able to find it.

Including me, but I'm a bit busy so may not have time.

https://www.dropbox.com/s/uwf0zmjkkbcm6u8/persistent (2020_07_06_16_06_16).sfs?dl=0

 

I think I sent the save file correctly so if anyone could please help me out that would be greatly appreciated.

I really need a fix to this. I had 4 mods installed via ckan; SCATTERER, X SCIENCE CONTINUED, and their dependencies for 1.9. I then updated to 1.10 with the outdated mods. I had been playing career for a few days without any problem but then my game crashed and when I restarted Commnet didn't work anymore as all my probes didn't have a signal but they used to. And now i have just found out that some of my vessels, 2 medium sized space stations, won't even let me switch to them through the tracking station. Every time I try I get put in an endless loading screen and when I launched a manned vessel to rendezvous with the station I could kind of see it but my game went down to 1FPS. I have uninstalled and reinstalled the mods to see what would work as well as uninstalling the game. Nothing worked. Commnet is enabled, I do have electric charge and no the tracking station isn't damaged. Any solution or idea would be appreciated. If there isn't a solution to the commnet problem then I hope there's one to fix my stations not loading. I hope my persistent save file from the career could hope to explain things. 

https://www.dropbox.com/s/uwf0zmjkkbcm6u8/persistent (2020_07_06_16_06_16).sfs?dl=0

KSP does make a backup of the last 5 auto saves, you can find them in this subfolder under your current career path "...\saves\<your career name>\Backup". Copy one from before the crash into your "...\saves\<your career name>" directory and see it that works.

Generally, making frequent and regular backups can help to avoid such situations.

I could load your save game file, but when trying to switch to a vessel, I do see the vessel after ESC, then nothing works, kind of freeze. Some flickering going on maybe once a second, but that's all. I think the save game file is corrupt.
Crossposted threads have been merged.   Please refrain from doing so, it only creates confusion and fractures the conversation.
